image.altText: Chickens stick their heads out from cages at a farm.

props.synopsis: With Australian officials closely monitoring local outbreaks of avian influenza, and another highly pathogenic strain wreaking havoc overseas, experts in infectious disease and public health say this is how we should prepare for the possibility of a future pandemic.

title.children: As the world grapples avian flu should we be bracing for the next pandemic?

image.altText: A sign says 'witch hunt'

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's conviction in the hush money trial in New York gives him another line to help push the conspiracy theory he's been promoting to his supporters all along.

title.children: Why Donald Trump's guilty verdict is perhaps now the most potent political weapon he has

image.altText: Joe Biden stands behind a lectern speaking with his hand and index finger in the air while making a point

props.synopsis: The three-stage proposal includes a permanent ceasefire and the return of Israeli hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners.

title.children: 'We can't lose this moment': Biden urges Hamas to accept latest ceasefire proposal from Israel to end war

image.altText: A white man with short brown hair and glasses sitting in an office. He's wearing a shirt and tie

props.synopsis: Julian Hill is one of a number of MPs calling for a complete ban on the use of genetic tests in life insurance assessments.

title.children: What a doctor told this MP about his family's genetic condition left him shocked

image.altText: Andrew Giles arrives for QT

props.synopsis: Amid the "direction 99" controversy, the importance of adequate investment in institutions in order to meet the needs of Australians is once again coming to a head.

title.children: The direction 99 controversy reflects a bare bureaucracy dropping the ball

image.altText: An AI generated image of tents forming letters reading All Eyes on Rafah

props.synopsis: An AI-generated image with the words "All eyes on Rafah" has ricocheted across social media, attracting million of shares. So how did a picture that's not even real become a defining image of the Israel-Gaza war? And has it made any difference?

title.children: 'All eyes on Rafah': This viral image has been celebrated and criticised on social media. But what difference has it really made?

image.altText: a man climbs over other politicians

props.synopsis: Taiwan's parliament has been thrown into chaos in recent weeks, with brawling on the floor of the chamber and huge citizen protests outside. Here's why.

title.children: Why have Taiwan's politicians been brawling in parliament?

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks at a press conference with american flags behind him.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump confirms he will appeal against his conviction for falsifying business records, as President Joe Biden criticises his "dangerous" claim the trial was rigged.

title.children: Convicted felon Trump plans appeal, Biden slams 'dangerous' claim trial was 'rigged'

image.altText: A soldier squats down to inspect fragments of a bomb surrounded by debris following an attack

props.synopsis: The statement followed US President Joe Biden's marked policy shift on Thursday, when he approved Ukraine using American weapons to strike targets inside Russia in defence of the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv.

title.children: Kremlin says Trump's conviction is about 'elimination of political rivals', as Russian forces advance in Ukraine

image.altText: A young blonde woman named Ariel Bombara sitting while being interviewed.

props.synopsis: A system designed to keep women safe seemingly follows all the right procedures and somehow two women are shot dead in their own home. What needs to change to fix it?

title.children: If everything was done right before the Floreat killings, why are two women dead?

image.altText: A group of males and females warming up on the road before they exercise

props.synopsis: When it's cold and dark, there's nothing less appealing than hitting the gym for a workout. Here's how to stay motivated to exercise when the temperature drops.

title.children: Don't let the cold weather stop you from exercising. Here's how to stay motivated in winter

image.altText: The black and white film is orange in tinge, and shows multiple frame of a boy eating an apple

props.synopsis: More than 10,000 reels of delicate film, including some of Australia's oldest movies, are packed to the rafters of the National Film and Sound Archive's Canberra storage facility.

title.children: Australia's most fragile and flammable film treasures get a budget boost

image.altText: A tight close-up of Donald Trump's face, as he looks down.

props.synopsis: It's difficult to overstate how significant the verdict in a Manhattan courtroom is to the future of the US. Americans are facing the very possible prospect of voting a felon into the White House.

title.children: History has just been made in New York City. It could shape America's future

image.altText: A sketch of Donald Trump in court.

props.synopsis: Forced to endure five weeks of painstaking testimony inside a drab Manhattan courthouse, a dozen New Yorkers were drawn into a House-of-Cards world of scandal, skulduggery and sex.

title.children: 'Would have been better left unsaid': Trump's conviction followed a trial about scandal, skulduggery and sex

image.altText: A blue Ticketek sign above a pair of pamphlets on a wall.

props.synopsis: The company says it has secure encryption methods in place for customer passwords, and no customer accounts or payment details had been compromised in the "cyber incident".

title.children: Ticketek Australia says customers' names, emails and dates of birth impacted by cyber security breach

image.altText: Bruce Lehrman leaves the Federal Court of Australia in Sydney 150424

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann lodges a notice of appeal with the Federal Court after a ruling by Justice Michael Lee that on the balance of probabilities he did rape Brittany Higgins at Parliament House in 2019.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann lodges notice of appeal after his defamation case failed in the Federal Court

image.altText: The outside of a shopping centre with grey walls.

props.synopsis: A man is in police custody after an alleged rampage at a Sunshine Coast shopping centre, where customers were allegedly threatened with scissors.

title.children: Man allegedly rampaging through Sunshine Coast shopping centre taken down by bystanders

image.altText: Large ship seen from above.

props.synopsis: A newly released report shows Australia's icebreaker, the RSV Nuyina, is facing a $100 million cost blowout by 2030 due to rising crew, fuel and maintenance costs.

title.children: Crewing and maintenance costs, fuel consumption leaves troubled vessel facing $100m cost blowout

image.altText: A screenshot of Thelma Plum's post of the All Eyes on Rafah story, showing 45.6 million shares

props.synopsis: We spoke to three experts to unpack the trending image and what it says about activism and war coverage in the social media sphere.

title.children: 'All Eyes on Rafah' trend has swept social media. But does it matter if it's AI?

image.altText: a street at night

props.synopsis: Court proceedings are delayed in Callum Luke Westcott Fisher's case due to the number of complainants coming forward. He worked as a security guard in Maroochydore's Safe Night precinct before his arrest.

title.children: Former security guard who allegedly raped multiple women faces new charges, bringing total number to 120

image.altText: A large white balloon carrying a bad of trash hovers over a rice field.

props.synopsis: The balloon dropping is an old-school Cold-War style provocation that has rarely been used in recent years.

title.children: North Korea's trash rains onto South Korea via hundreds of balloons. Here's why

image.altText: A man stands over two men falling to the ground, as police offers watch, in a paved square. Everyone's faces are blurred.

props.synopsis: Social media footage showed a bearded man attacking people with a knife in the city's central Marktplatz square, where an anti-Islam activist was preparing to address a small crowd.

title.children: German police shoot man who stabbed police, attendees at far-right demonstration

image.altText: A burnt-out car sits next to a burning car with flames and black smoke pouring from it on a motorway surrounded by green trees

props.synopsis: France's interior minister says security forces have regained control of the capital but violence continues in other parts of the country.

title.children: After clearing barricades and spotting snipers, France declares New Caledonia's capital Noumea under control after deadly riots

image.altText: A woman in a red hat leaning on a rusty bar of a gate.

props.synopsis: The National Portrait Gallery on Friday told Senate estimates that Gina Rinehart had gifted the artwork, following the controversy around a different portrait of the mining magnate by Vincent Namatjira, which hangs in the National Gallery of Australia.

title.children: Gina Rinehart gifts Canberra gallery a portrait of herself, but with conditions

image.altText: An aerial shot of a waterway and a small town.

props.synopsis: Vincent Edward Down was last seen in 1969. A coroner has now handed down findings into his death.

title.children: 'I may have washed out the back of the ute': Murder suspect made late-night admission at police officer's home

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair in all black posing for a photo

props.synopsis: The model is the fourth woman to speak out about how they were treated on the red carpet at the French film festival.

title.children: Ukrainian model says she is suing Cannes Film festival over 'unreasonable force' by staff

image.altText: Chrystal blue waters and swimmers.

props.synopsis: They're home to subtropical beaches that city slickers dream of, but an emerging trend shows some regional movers are moving away again from Australia's most popular regional cities after arrival.

title.children: Growing pains turn movers away from popular coastal cities as 'the dream is not always what they presume'

image.altText: Harriet Dyer with a clapper board and Patrick Brammall holding a dog (Colin) standing outside on the street

props.synopsis: The critically acclaimed Colin from Accounts is the most-watched original scripted series from Foxtel Group. Its stars are "still processing" the show's overwhelming success as season two gets underway.

title.children: 'Funny, a bit cringe and real': Why Colin From Accounts is resonating with viewers

image.altText: Child holds up trophy.

props.synopsis: Bruhat Soma, a 12-year-old from Tampa, Florida, won the 96th Scripps National Spelling Bee in a spell-off and claimed $US50,000 ($75,000).

title.children: Quiz: Are you smarter than a 12-year-old spelling bee champion?

image.altText: A triptych of the director Baz Luhrmann, black hat, green jacket, grey hair, with a little microphone in his face

props.synopsis: When Australian TikToker Georgia Godworth approached a stylish man, she didn't realise who he was — now, their interview has gone viral.

title.children: A TikToker interviewed Baz Luhrmann on the streets of Newtown … and had no idea who he was

image.altText: A woman and a man stand in a paddock next to a river in front of three horses.

props.synopsis: Horse owners aren't trying to "limit anyone's fun", but are calling for more neighbourly consideration at next year's cracker night in lieu of the difficulties faced by law enforcement.

title.children: 'Potentially deadly' cracker night a yearly event that owners fear will send their horses into a frenzy

image.altText: A mass of protesters carrying signs that say "guilty".

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has been found guilty on 34 felony counts of falsifying business records in his New York criminal trial relating to "hush money" payments paid to adult film star Stormy Daniels.

title.children: Trump lashes out after being found guilty on 34 counts — as it happened

image.altText: Ged Kearney wearing a bright red jacket, sitting at her desk with a nurse union flag in the background.

props.synopsis: Doctors and midwives say Medicare rebates are rife with sexism, with some larger for faster and less complex procedures for men.

title.children: Medicare to be audited for sexism in rebates, starting with ultrasounds and contraception

image.altText: a composite image of a little boy and a pool sign

props.synopsis: The County Court in Warrnambool heard Port Fairy pool operators did not test children's swimming abilities before allowing them to use an inflatable aquatic device and did not have procedures in place for how to manage children on the device.

title.children: Pool operator fined for safety breaches surrounding death of 8yo boy

image.altText: A row of white electric vehicles lined up in a showroom.

props.synopsis: The rapid rise of Chinese electric vehicles has been met with resistance in the US and Europe. So why are Australians buying them at record levels?

title.children: Why Chinese-made cars are becoming so common on Australia's roads
